Maurizio Sarri has made 124 substitutions since he’s in charge of Chelsea:

13x Barkley on for Kovacic
8x Pedro on for Willian
7x Kovacic on for Barkley

Zinedine Zidane has been linked with succeeding Sarri, but there are doubts over whether he would find the Chelsea job an attractive proposition and his command of English would have to improve dramatically.

Fan favourite Frank Lampard, who is in charge at Derby County, would find it hard to turn down his old club, while Laurent Blanc would be interested. [Matt Law]

Following the FA Cup defeat to Manchester United and the Stamford Bridge revolt against Sarri, the Italian could be dismissed if Chelsea lose either of their games against Malmo in the Europa League on Thursday night or Manchester City in Sunday’s Carabao Cup final.

Sarri is sacked in the near future, assistant-manager Gianfranco Zola is most likely to be asked to take caretaker charge until the end of the season. [Matt Law]

The identity of Chelsea’s next permanent boss is less sure, especially with huge uncertainty over the club’s future. Doubts remain over owner Roman Abramovich’s commitment to Chelsea, with persistent rumours the Russian wants to sell. #CFC (Mail)
Gianfranco Zola, Sarri’s assistant, is most likely to take the reins, particularly given he has Premier League managerial experience. #CFC (Mail)

Technical coach Eddie Newton, who has been employed in Chelsea’s senior set-up on several occasions, is another option, as is former Blues defender Paulo Ferreira, who works alongside Newton. #CFC (Mail)

Frustrations with Sarri’s tactics were aired during Monday’s fiery debrief. Chelsea stars have become more hostile to his instructions in recent weeks, particularly with his stubborn commitment to his Sarri-ball philosophy. #CFC (Mail)

replies.msg: As one person who knew Sarri well from Napoli says: “He talks infront of the cameras exactly the same way as if he was going for a cigarette out back with his mate. You cannot do that unless you win every game.” And the communication issues extend to squad management (Times) #CFC

Chelsea presumably did their homework and knew that it was going to look like this. They knew Sarri would require time [taking over late did not help], they knew they could not overhaul the squad and they knew this meant taking a gamble. (Times) #CFC
